2025-09-02.content:
You can now create a [remote model based on an open embedding model from Vertex Model Garden or Hugging Face that is deployed to Vertex AI](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-remote-model-open). Options include E5 Embedding and other leading open embedding generation models. You can then use the [`ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING` function](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-embedding) with this remote model to generate embeddings.

Try this feature with the [Generate text embeddings by using an open model and the `ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING` function](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/generate-text-embedding-tutorial-open-models) tutorial.

This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New Feature: Create remote models with open embedding models
summary.summary: You can now create a remote model based on open embedding models from Vertex Model Garden or Hugging Face deployed to Vertex AI. Use the ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING function with this remote model to generate embeddings. This feature is in Preview.

2025-09-02.content: You can now create a [remote model](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-remote-model) based on the Vertex AI `gemini-embedding-001` model. You can then use the [`ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING` function](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-embedding) with this remote model to generate embeddings. This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New remote model for embeddings
summary.summary: BigQuery now supports creating remote models with Vertex AI's gemini-embedding-001. Use ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING to create text embeddings. This feature is in Preview.

2025-09-02.content: You can now reference BigQuery ML and DataFrames in your [prompts](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/colab-data-science-agent#sample-prompts) when you use the [Data Science Agent](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/colab-data-science-agent) in a BigQuery notebook. The Data Science Agent is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: BigQuery ML and DataFrames Integration
summary.summary: The Data Science Agent in BigQuery notebooks now supports referencing BigQuery ML and DataFrames in prompts.

2025-09-02.content: You can now configure listings for multiple regions for shared datasets and linked dataset replicas in BigQuery sharing. For more information, see [Create a listing](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-manage-listings#create_a_listing). This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Configure multi-region listings for BigQuery datasets
summary.summary: BigQuery sharing now supports configuring multi-region listings for shared datasets and linked dataset replicas. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-09-02.content: You can now enable the automatic selection of a processing location in your pipeline configurations. For more information, see [Create pipelines](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/create-pipelines). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Automatic processing location selection
summary.summary: The pipeline configuration now supports automatic selection of a processing location. This feature is generally available.

summary.title: Go and Java client library updates
summary.summary: This release includes updates to the Go client library with new features for BigQuery reservations and storage, as well as improvements to load/extract job handling. The Java client library for BigQuery has also been updated with dependency changes.

2025-08-28.content: For additional layers of security and control, you can now use query templates to predefine and limit the queries that can be run in data clean rooms. For more information, see [Use query templates](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/query-templates). This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Predefined queries for data clean rooms
summary.summary: Query templates are now available to predefine and limit queries in data clean rooms, enhancing security and control. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-08-26.content: You can [deduplicate table data](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-prep-get-suggestions#deduplicate) with Gemini assistance in your [BigQuery data preparations](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-prep-introduction). Deduplication is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Deduplicate table data
summary.summary: Deduplicate your BigQuery table data with Gemini assistance. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-08-25.content: You can use the [`ST_REGIONSTATS` geography function](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/geography_functions#st_regionstats) to combine raster data using Earth Engine with your vector data stored in BigQuery. For more information, see [Work with raster data](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/raster-data) and try the tutorial that shows you how to [use raster data to analyze global temperature](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/raster-tutorial-weather). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: ST_REGIONSTATS geography function
summary.summary: Combine Earth Engine raster data with your BigQuery vector data.

2025-08-25.content: You can now use data insights to have Gemini [generate table and column descriptions from table metadata](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-insights). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Gemini can now generate table and column descriptions
summary.summary: Gemini can now generate table and column descriptions from table metadata using data insights. This feature is now generally available.

2025-08-22.content: Multi-statement transactions are now available for [BigLake Iceberg tables in BigQuery](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/iceberg-tables#use_multi-statement_transactions). This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New: Multi-statement Transactions for BigLake Iceberg Tables
summary.summary: Multi-statement transactions for BigLake Iceberg tables.

2025-08-21.content:
Starting September 25, 2025, the BigQuery Data Transfer Service for third-party SAAS and database connectors will update to a consumption-based pricing model. With this new pricing model, you will be charged based on the compute resources consumed by your data transfers, measured in slot-hours. For more information, see [Data Transfer Service pricing](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/pricing#section-5). This pricing update applies to the following third-party connectors when they are [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages):

* [Facebook Ads](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/facebook-ads-transfer)
* [MySQL](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/mysql-transfer)
* [Oracle](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/oracle-transfer)
* [PostgreSQL](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/postgresql-transfer)
* [Salesforce](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/salesforce-transfer)
* [Salesforce Marketing Cloud](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/sfmc-transfer)
* [ServiceNow](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/servicenow-transfer)
* Other third-party connectors planned for future releases

summary.title: Pricing Update
summary.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service pricing update for third-party connectors.

2025-08-18.content:
In the BigQuery console, you can now use the **Reference** panel to do the following:

* In the query editor, you can use the [Reference panel](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/running-queries#use-reference-panel) to preview the schema details of tables, snapshots, views, and materialized views, or open these resources in a new tab. You can also use the panel to construct new queries or edit existing queries by inserting query snippets or field names.
* In the notebook editor, you can use the [Reference panel](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/create-notebooks#create-notebook-console) to preview the schema details of tables, snapshots, views, or materialized views, or open these resources in a new tab.

This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Reference Panel Now Available in BigQuery
summary.summary: Preview schema details and construct queries using the Reference panel in BigQuery.

2025-08-18.content: When you use the Data Science Agent in BigQuery, you can now use the [table selector](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/colab-data-science-agent#analyze-table) to choose one or more BigQuery tables to analyze. The Data Science Agent is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New Table Selector for BigQuery Data Science Agent
summary.summary: Easily select BigQuery tables for analysis with the Data Science Agent.

2025-08-14.content: You can now [visualize your geospatial query results](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/geospatial-visualize) on an interactive map in BigQuery studio. This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Geospatial Visualization
summary.summary: Visualize your geospatial query results on an interactive map.

2025-08-14.content: You can use [cross region federated queries](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/spanner-federated-queries#cross_region_queries) to query Spanner tables from regions other than the source BigQuery region. These cross region queries incur additional [Spanner network egress charges](https://cloud.google.com/spanner/pricing#network). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: New Spanner feature
summary.summary: Cross-region queries for Spanner are now available.

2025-08-13.content: You can aggregate table data with Gemini assistance in your [BigQuery data preparations](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-prep-get-suggestions). Aggregations in data preparations are in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Feature Announcement
summary.summary: Aggregate table data with Gemini assistance.

2025-08-12.content: You can now [save query results to Cloud Storage](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/export-file#saving-query-results-to-cloud-storage). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: New Cloud Storage Feature
summary.summary: Query results can now be saved to Cloud Storage.

summary.title: BigQuery resource utilization charts
summary.summary: BigQuery resource utilization charts are now generally available.

2025-08-11.content: You can now use [`WITH` expressions](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/operators#with_expression) in your GoogleSQL queries to create temporary variables. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: New Feature: WITH expressions
summary.summary: Use WITH expressions for temporary variables.

2025-08-11.content: You can now use [chained function call syntax](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/functions-reference#chained-function-calls) in GoogleSQL to make deeply nested function calls easier to read. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Chained Function Calls Now Available
summary.summary: Easily read nested function calls with chained function syntax.

2025-08-11.content: BigQuery data preparations are now represented in the SQLX format and in the pipe query syntax to simplify the CI/CD code review process. For more information, see [Manage data preparations](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/manage-data-preparations).

summary.title: Updated BigQuery Data Preparations
summary.summary: BigQuery data preparations are now in SQLX format and pipe query syntax.

2025-08-06.content: Enabling the advanced runtime now includes [short query optimizations](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/advanced-runtime#short_query_optimizations). This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New feature available
summary.summary: Short query optimizations are now available with advanced runtime.

2025-08-04.content:
You can now use the new [Data Science Agent (DSA)](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/colab-data-science-agent) for Colab Enterprise and BigQuery to automate exploratory data analysis, perform
machine learning tasks, and deliver insights all within a
Colab Enterprise notebook. This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New Data Science Agent for Colab Enterprise
summary.summary: Automate data analysis and machine learning tasks in Colab Enterprise.

2025-07-31.content: You can manage data profile scans and data quality scans across your project by using the **Metadata curation** page in the Google Cloud console. For more information, see [Profile your data](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-profile-scan) and [Scan for data quality issues](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-quality-scan). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: New Feature: Data Scan Management
summary.summary: Manage data scans on the Metadata curation page.

2025-07-31.content:
BigQuery ML has improved throughput by more than 100x for the following
generative AI functions:

* [`ML.GENERATE_TEXT`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-text)
* [`AI.GENERATE_TABLE`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-table)
* [`AI.GENERATE`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate)
* [`AI.GENERATE_BOOL`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate-bool)
* [`AI.GENERATE_DOUBLE`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate-double)
* [`AI.GENERATE_INT`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate-int)

Actual performance varies based on the number of input and output tokens in the
request, but a typical 6-hour job can now process millions of rows. For more
information, see
[Generative AI functions](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/quotas#generative_ai_functions).

summary.title: Improved BigQuery ML Performance
summary.summary: BigQuery ML boosts generative AI function throughput by over 100x.

2025-07-31.content: BigQuery ML now can automatically detect model quota increases in Vertex AI, and automatically adjusts the quota for any BigQuery ML functions that use those models. You no longer need to email the BigQuery ML team to increase model quota.

summary.title: BigQuery ML Model Quota Updates
summary.summary: BigQuery ML now automatically detects and adjusts model quotas in Vertex AI, eliminating the need to contact the BigQuery ML team for increases.

2025-07-31.content: You can now use [continuous queries](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/continuous-queries-introduction) to [export BigQuery data to Spanner in real time](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/export-to-spanner). This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Real-time Spanner Exports
summary.summary: Real-time data export to Spanner with continuous queries.

2025-07-30.content: The Gemini for Google Cloud API (cloudaicompanion.googleapis.com) is now enabled by default for most BigQuery projects. Exceptions include projects where customers have opted out, and those linked to accounts based in EMEA regions including [BigQuery Europe, Middle East, and Africa regions](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/locations#supported_locations).

summary.title: Gemini for Google Cloud in BigQuery
summary.summary: Gemini for Google Cloud is now enabled by default for most BigQuery projects.

2025-07-28.content: You can now associate [data policies directly on columns](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/column-data-masking#data-policies-on-column). This feature enables direct database administration for controlling access and applying masking and transformation rules at the column level. This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New Feature: Column-level data policies
summary.summary: Data policies can now be associated directly on columns for database administration, access control, and masking/transformation rules.

2025-07-22.content:
You can now use the
[`VECTOR_INDEX.STATISTICS` function](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/vectorindex_functions#vector_indexstatistics) to calculate how much an indexed table's data has drifted between when a
vector index was created and the present. If table data has changed enough
to require a [vector index rebuild](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/vector-index#rebuild_a_vector_index), you can use the
[`ALTER VECTOR INDEX REBUILD` statement](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/data-definition-language#alter_vector_index_rebuild_statement)
to rebuild the vector index. This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New Feature: Vector Index Monitoring
summary.summary: Check vector index data drift and rebuild if necessary.

summary.title: Access Transparency for BigQuery
summary.summary: Access Transparency now supports BigQuery data preparation.

2025-07-22.content:
The [`CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/data-definition-language#create_external_table_statement) and [`LOAD DATA`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/load-statements) statements now support the following options in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages):

* `null_markers`: define the strings that represent `NULL` values in CSV files.
* `source_column_match`: specify how loaded columns are matched to the schema. You can match columns by position or by name.

summary.title: New options available
summary.summary: New options for CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE and LOAD DATA

2025-07-22.content: You can now use the [`MATCH_RECOGNIZE` clause](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/query-syntax#match_recognize_clause) in your SQL queries to filter and aggregate matches across rows in a table. This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New SQL Feature
summary.summary: Filter and aggregate matches across rows using the MATCH_RECOGNIZE clause.

summary.title: Client Library Updates: Java and Python
summary.summary: This is a weekly digest of client library updates across the Cloud SDK, featuring new features like OpenTelemetry support and custom timezone handling for Java, alongside various enhancements and bug fixes in the Python library, including updates to job configuration and data handling.

2025-07-21.content: You can now use the [`DISTINCT` pipe operator](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/pipe-syntax#distinct_pipe_operator) to select distinct rows from a table in your pipe syntax queries. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: DISTINCT pipe operator is now GA
summary.summary: You can now use the DISTINCT pipe operator to select distinct rows from a table in your pipe syntax queries. This feature is generally available.

2025-07-17.content: You can now use the [`WITH` pipe operator](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/pipe-syntax#with_pipe_operator) to define common table expressions in your pipe syntax queries. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: `WITH` Pipe Operator Now Available in BigQuery
summary.summary: BigQuery now supports the `WITH` pipe operator for defining common table expressions in pipe syntax queries. This enhancement is now generally available.

2025-07-17.content: You can now use [named windows](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/pipe-syntax#select_pipe_operator) in your pipe syntax queries. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Named windows are now GA
summary.summary: Named windows are now generally available in pipe syntax queries.

2025-07-16.content: You can now add comments to [notebooks](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/create-notebooks#create-notebook-console), [data canvases](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-canvas#work-with-data-canvas), [data preparation files](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-prep-get-suggestions#open-data-prep-editor), or [saved queries](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/work-with-saved-queries#create_saved_queries). You can also reply to existing comments or get a link to them. This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Add comments to BigQuery assets
summary.summary: You can now add comments to notebooks, data canvases, data preparation files, or saved queries. You can also reply to comments or get a link to them. This feature is in Preview.

2025-07-16.content:
You can now create [BigQuery ML models by using the
Google Cloud console user interface](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/create-machine-learning-model-console). This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: BigQuery ML models creation in Google Cloud console
summary.summary: You can now create BigQuery ML models using the Google Cloud console interface. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-07-15.content: You can now [commercialize your BigQuery sharing listings on Google Cloud Marketplace](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-cloud-marketplace). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Commercialize BigQuery listings on Google Cloud Marketplace
summary.summary: You can now commercialize your BigQuery sharing listings on Google Cloud Marketplace. This feature is generally available.

2025-07-15.content: You can flatten [JSON columns](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-prep-get-suggestions#flatten-json) in BigQuery data preparation with a single operation. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Flatten JSON columns in BigQuery
summary.summary: You can now flatten JSON columns in BigQuery data preparation with a single operation. This feature is generally available.

2025-07-08.content: Starting August 1, 2025, GoogleSQL will become the default dialect for queries run from the command line interface (CLI) or API. To use LegacySQL, you will need to explicitly specify it in your requests or [set the configuration setting](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/data-definition-language#alter_project_set_options_statement) `default_sql_dialect_option` to `'default_legacy_sql'` at the project or organization level.

summary.title: GoogleSQL becomes default CLI/API dialect on August 1, 2025
summary.summary: GoogleSQL will be the default dialect for CLI and API queries starting August 1, 2025. LegacySQL will require explicit specification or a configuration setting change.

2025-07-07.content:
You can now use your Google Account user credentials to authorize the execution of a data preparation in development. For more information, see
[Manually run a data preparation in development](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/orchestrate-data-preparations#run-undeployed-manually). This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Use Google Account Credentials for Data Preparation Authorization
summary.summary: You can now use your Google Account user credentials to authorize the execution of a data preparation in development. This feature is in preview.

2025-07-01.content: You can now [update a Cloud KMS encryption key](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/customer-managed-encryption#key_rotation) by updating the table with the same key. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Key update feature now available
summary.summary: You can now update a Cloud KMS encryption key by updating the table with the same key. This feature is generally available.

2025-07-01.content: You can use the [`@@location` system variable](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/system-variables) to set the location in which to run a query. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Query location now available
summary.summary: You can now set the location for your queries using the @@location system variable. This feature is generally available.

2025-07-01.content:
BigQuery now supports the following Apache Hadoop migration features in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages):

* [Use the `dwh-migration-dumper` tool to migrate the metadata](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/hadoop-metadata) necessary for a Hadoop permissions and data migration.
* [Migrate permissions from Apache Hadoop, Apache Hive, and Ranger HDFS](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/hadoop-permissions-migration) to BigQuery.
* [Migrate tables from a HDFS data lake](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/hdfs-data-lake-transfer) to Google Cloud.

summary.title: BigQuery enhances Hadoop migration support
summary.summary: BigQuery is introducing new features to help migrate data from Apache Hadoop, including tools for metadata and permissions migration, as well as transferring tables from HDFS data lakes.

2025-06-30.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the [Cloud SDK](https://cloud.google.com/sdk).

### Java

summary.title: Java BigQuery Library Update
summary.summary: This release of the Java client library for BigQuery includes new features such as OpenTelemetry integration for enhanced monitoring and several bug fixes and dependency updates.

2025-06-30.content: You can now [create and manage scheduled notebooks](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/orchestrate-notebooks) using the **Schedule details** pane in BigQuery Studio. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Schedule notebook runs in BigQuery Studio
summary.summary: You can now orchestrate your notebooks using the Schedule details pane in BigQuery Studio. This feature is generally available.

2025-06-26.content:
You can now use the
use the `PARTITION BY` clause of the
[`CREATE VECTOR INDEX` statement](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/data-definition-language#create_vector_index_statement) to [partition TreeAH vector indexes](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/vector-index#partitions). Partitioning enables partition pruning and can decrease I/O costs. This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: BigQuery adds support for partitioning TreeAH vector indexes
summary.summary: BigQuery now supports partitioning for TreeAH vector indexes using the PARTITION BY clause in the CREATE VECTOR INDEX statement. This feature, currently in preview, can help reduce I/O costs through partition pruning.

2025-06-26.content: [BigQuery search indexes](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/search-intro) provide free index management until your organization reaches the [limit](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/quotas#index_limits) in a given region. You can now use the [`INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SEARCH_INDEXES_BY_ORGANIZATION` view](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/information-schema-indexes-by-organization) to understand your current consumption towards that limit, broken down by projects and tables. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: BigQuery Search Indexes Now GA
summary.summary: BigQuery search indexes offer free management up to regional limits. You can now monitor your organization's index consumption by project and table using the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SEARCH_INDEXES_BY_ORGANIZATION view. This feature is now generally available.

2025-06-23.content: You can now use the [Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/blms-rest-catalog) to create interoperability between your query engines by allowing your open source engines to access Iceberg data in Cloud Storage. This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: BigLake metastore now supports Apache Iceberg REST catalog
summary.summary: You can now use the Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore to create interoperability between your query engines. This allows open source engines to access Iceberg data in Cloud Storage. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-06-23.content:
Colab Enterprise notebooks in BigQuery let you do the following in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages):

* [Explain code with Gemini assistance](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/write-sql-gemini#explain_python_code)
* [Fix and explain errors with Gemini assistance](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/write-sql-gemini#fix_and_explain_python_errors)

summary.title: Colab Enterprise notebooks in BigQuery
summary.summary: BigQuery now supports Colab Enterprise notebooks, allowing you to leverage Gemini assistance for code explanation and error resolution directly within your BigQuery environment.

2025-06-18.content: You can now [publish the results of a data quality scan as Dataplex Universal Catalog metadata](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-quality-scan). Previously, data quality scan results were published only to the Google Cloud console. The latest results are saved to the entry that represents the source table. You can view the results in the Google Cloud console. If you want to enable catalog publishing for an existing data quality scan, you must edit the scan and re-enable the publishing option. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Data Quality Scan Results Now Available in Dataplex Catalog
summary.summary: Data quality scan results can now be published as Dataplex Universal Catalog metadata, with the latest results saved to the source table's entry. This feature is generally available and viewable in the Google Cloud console.

2025-06-18.content: You can now use data insights to have Gemini [generate table and column descriptions from table metadata](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/data-insights). This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Gemini generates table descriptions
summary.summary: Gemini can now create table and column descriptions from metadata, using data insights. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-06-16.content: In BigQuery ML, you can now forecast multiple time series at once by using the [`TIME_SERIES_ID_COL` option](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-multivariate-time-series#time_series_id_col) that is available in `ARIMA_PLUS_XREG` multivariate time series models. Try this feature with the [Forecast multiple time series with a multivariate model](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/arima-plus-xreg-multiple-time-series-forecasting-tutorial) tutorial. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Forecasting Multiple Time Series in BigQuery ML
summary.summary: BigQuery ML now supports forecasting multiple time series simultaneously using the `TIME_SERIES_ID_COL` option in `ARIMA_PLUS_XREG` models. This enhancement allows for more efficient analysis of multiple time series data. Check out the tutorial for a practical guide.

2025-06-16.content: You can now manage [IAM tags](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/tags) on BigQuery datasets and tables using SQL. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Manage IAM tags on BigQuery datasets and tables using SQL
summary.summary: You can now manage IAM tags on BigQuery datasets and tables using SQL. This feature is generally available.

2025-06-16.content: The BigQuery migration assessment is now available for workflows that use [Cloudera and Apache Hadoop](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/migration-assessment#hadoop-cloudera). This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: BigQuery migration assessment now supports Hadoop and Cloudera
summary.summary: The BigQuery migration assessment tool now supports workflows utilizing Cloudera and Apache Hadoop. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-06-16.content: The [Merchant Center best sellers report](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/merchant-center-best-sellers-schema) supports multi-client accounts (MCAs). If you have an MCA, you can use the `aggregator_id` to query the tables. The `BestSellersEntityProductMapping` table maps the best-selling entities to the products in the sub-accounts' inventory. This provides a consolidated view of best-selling products, which you can then join with product data for more detailed insights. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Merchant Center best sellers report now supports MCAs
summary.summary: The Merchant Center best sellers report now supports multi-client accounts (MCAs), allowing you to use the `aggregator_id` for queries. The `BestSellersEntityProductMapping` table helps map best-selling products across sub-accounts, providing a consolidated view for deeper analysis.

2025-06-16.content:
BigQuery now offers the following Gemini-enhanced SQL translation features:

* Create [Gemini-based configuration YAML files](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/config-yaml-translation#ai_yaml_guidelines) to generate AI suggestions for batch or interactive SQL translations. This feature is now [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).
* After making a batch SQL translation, review your translation output, including Gemini-based suggestions, using the [code tab](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/batch-sql-translator#code-tab) and [configuration tab](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/batch-sql-translator#configuration_tab). This feature is now [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).
* When making an interactive SQL translation, [create and apply Gemini-enhanced translation rules](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/interactive-sql-translator#create-apply-rules) to customize your SQL inputs. This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Gemini enhances BigQuery SQL translation
summary.summary: BigQuery has enhanced its SQL translation capabilities with Gemini. Users can now leverage Gemini-based configurations for SQL translations, with features for both batch and interactive use cases now generally available. Additionally, interactive SQL translation allows for the creation and application of customized, Gemini-enhanced translation rules during the preview phase.

2025-06-12.content: Dark theme is now available for BigQuery in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages). To enable the dark theme, in the Google Cloud console, click **Settings and utilities > Preferences**. In the navigation menu, click **Appearance**, and then select your color theme and click **Save**.

summary.title: Dark Theme Now Available for BigQuery
summary.summary: You can now enable a dark theme for BigQuery in the Google Cloud console. To do this, navigate to Settings and utilities > Preferences > Appearance and select your preferred color theme.

2025-06-11.content:
The following GoogleSQL functions are now available in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages):

* The [`ARRAY_FIRST` function](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/array_functions#array_first) returns the first element of the input array.
* The [`ARRAY_LAST` function](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/array_functions#array_last) returns the last element of the input array.
* The [`ARRAY_SLICE` function](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/array_functions#array_slice) returns an array that contains consecutive elements from the input array.

summary.title: New GoogleSQL functions available
summary.summary: Two new GoogleSQL functions, ARRAY_LAST and ARRAY_SLICE, are now available in preview to help you manipulate array data.

2025-06-10.content: An updated version of the [ODBC driver for BigQuery](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/odbc-jdbc-drivers#odbc_release_3121009) is now available.

summary.title: Updated ODBC driver for BigQuery
summary.summary: An updated version of the ODBC driver for BigQuery has been released.

2025-06-10.content:
For [supported Gemini models](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/provisioned-throughput/supported-models), you can now use [Vertex AI Provisioned Throughput](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/provisioned-throughput/overview) with the [`ML.GENERATE_TEXT`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-text#provisioned-throughput)and [`AI.GENERATE`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-ai-generate#provisioned-throughput) functions to provide consistent high throughput for requests.

This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Vertex AI Provisioned Throughput now available in BigQuery
summary.summary: You can now use Vertex AI Provisioned Throughput with the ML.GENERATE_TEXT and AI.GENERATE functions in BigQuery. This provides consistent high throughput for requests to supported Gemini models and is now generally available.

2025-06-09.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the [Cloud SDK](https://cloud.google.com/sdk).

### Java

### Changes for [google-cloud-bigquery](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery)

##### Features

* **bigquery:** Job creation mode GA ([#3804](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/issues/3804)) ([a21cde8](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/commit/a21cde8994e93337326cc4a2deb4bafd1596b77f))
* **bigquery:** Support Fine Grained ACLs for Datasets ([#3803](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/issues/3803)) ([bebf1c6](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/commit/bebf1c610e6d050c49fc05f30d3fa0247b7dfdcb))

##### Dependencies

* Rollback netty.version to v4.1.119.Final ([#3827](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/issues/3827)) ([94c71a0](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/commit/94c71a090eab745c81dd9530bcdd3c8c1e734788))
* Update dependency com.google.api.grpc:proto-google-cloud-bigqueryconnection-v1 to v2.65.0 ([#3787](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/issues/3787)) ([0574ecc](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/commit/0574eccec2975738804be7d0ccb4c973459c82c9))
* Update dependency com.google.apis:google-api-services-bigquery to v2-rev20250511-2.0.0 ([#3794](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/issues/3794)) ([d3bf724](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/commit/d3bf724feef91469b44e1e5068738604d2b3cead))
* Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.49.0 ([#3811](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/issues/3811)) ([2c5ede4](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/commit/2c5ede4b115cf7cdd078d54d29ce93636c1cedf5))

summary.title: Java BigQuery Client Library Updates
summary.summary: This release of the Java client library for BigQuery introduces new features such as GA for job creation mode and support for Fine Grained Access Control Lists for Datasets. It also includes dependency updates and a rollback for the netty version.

2025-06-09.content: You can reference [Iceberg external tables in materialized views](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/materialized-views-create#iceberg) instead of migrating that data to BigQuery-managed storage. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Iceberg external tables in materialized views are now GA
summary.summary: You can now use Iceberg external tables in materialized views without migrating data to BigQuery-managed storage. This feature is generally available.

2025-06-04.content: The organization-level [configuration settings](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/default-configuration) for `default_sql_dialect_option` and `query_runtime` are unsupported.

summary.title: Unsupported configuration settings
summary.summary: The organization-level configuration settings for default SQL dialect option and query runtime are unsupported.

2025-06-03.content: You can now use the [BigQuery advanced runtime](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/advanced-runtime) to improve query execution time and slot usage. This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: BigQuery advanced runtime now in Preview
summary.summary: BigQuery’s advanced runtime is now available in Preview, allowing for improved query execution times and slot utilization.

2025-06-03.content: BigQuery tables for Apache Iceberg have been renamed [BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/iceberg-tables). This feature is now [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: BigQuery support for Apache Iceberg is now GA
summary.summary: BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery are now generally available, with tables having been renamed.

2025-06-03.content: BigQuery metastore has been renamed [BigLake metastore](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/about-blms) and is now [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA). The feature formerly known as BigLake metastore has been renamed BigLake metastore (classic).

summary.title: BigQuery metastore is now BigLake metastore
summary.summary: BigQuery metastore has been renamed to BigLake metastore and is now generally available. The feature previously known as BigLake metastore is now called BigLake metastore (classic).

2025-06-02.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the [Cloud SDK](https://cloud.google.com/sdk).

summary.title: Client Library Updates: BigQuery
summary.summary: This is a weekly digest of client library updates across Node.js, Go, and Python BigQuery libraries. Key updates include the GA release of job creation mode for Node.js and Go, and enhancements to Analytics Hub and Marketplace integration in Go.

2025-06-02.content: In the navigation menu, you can now go to **Settings** and select **Configuration settings** to [customize the BigQuery Studio experience](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/bigquery-web-ui#navigation_menu) for users within the selected project or organization. This is achieved by showing or hiding user interface elements. This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Customize BigQuery Studio Experience
summary.summary: You can now customize the BigQuery Studio experience by showing or hiding UI elements through configuration settings. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-06-02.content: BigQuery now supports using [Spanner external datasets](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/spanner-external-datasets) with [authorized views](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/authorized-views), [authorized routines](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/authorized-routines), and [Cloud resource connections](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/create-cloud-resource-connection). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products?e=48754805&hl=en#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: BigQuery adds Spanner external datasets support
summary.summary: BigQuery now supports Spanner external datasets with authorized views, authorized routines, and Cloud resource connections. This feature is generally available.

2025-06-02.content:
The [`CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/data-definition-language#create_external_table_statement) and [`LOAD DATA`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/load-statements) statements now support the following options in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages):

* `time_zone`: specify a time zone to use when loading data
* `date_format`, `datetime_format`, `time_format`, and `timestamp_format`: define how date and time values are formatted in your source files

summary.title: New options for data loading and external tables
summary.summary: You can now specify time zone and date/time formats when creating external tables or loading data using the `CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE` and `LOAD DATA` statements.

2025-06-02.content: In the BigQuery console, in the **Welcome** tab, you can now try the [Apache Spark demo notebook](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/bigquery-web-ui#run_spark_notebook_demo_guide) that walks you through the basics of Spark notebook and showcases [serverless Spark in BigQuery](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/use-spark). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Try the new Spark demo notebook in BigQuery
summary.summary: You can now explore a new Apache Spark demo notebook directly within the BigQuery console. This feature, now generally available, guides you through the fundamentals of Spark notebooks and highlights the capabilities of serverless Spark in BigQuery.

2025-05-29.content: You can now use the `dbt-bigquery` adapter to run Python code that's defined in BigQuery DataFrames. For more information, see [Use BigQuery DataFrames in dbt](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/dataframes-dbt). This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: BigQuery DataFrames in dbt
summary.summary: You can now use the `dbt-bigquery` adapter to run Python code defined in BigQuery DataFrames. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-05-29.content: You can now use your Google Account user credentials to authorize the creation, scheduling, and running of pipelines as well as the scheduling of notebooks and data preparations. For more information, see [Create a pipeline schedule](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/schedule-pipelines#create-schedule). This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Authorize pipeline creation and scheduling with your Google Account
summary.summary: You can now use your Google Account credentials to authorize the creation, scheduling, and running of pipelines, as well as the scheduling of notebooks and data preparations. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-05-29.content: You can now create [event-driven transfers](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/event-driven-transfer) when transferring data from Cloud Storage to BigQuery. Event-driven transfers can automatically trigger transfer runs when data in your Cloud Storage bucket has been modified or added. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: New feature: Event-driven transfers from Cloud Storage to BigQuery
summary.summary: You can now create event-driven transfers from Cloud Storage to BigQuery. These transfers automatically trigger when data in your Cloud Storage bucket is modified or added, and this feature is now generally available.

2025-05-28.content: You can now create a [serverless Spark session and run PySpark code in a BigQuery notebook](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/use-spark). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Serverless Spark sessions in BigQuery notebooks are now available
summary.summary: You can now create a serverless Spark session and run PySpark code in a BigQuery notebook. This feature is generally available.

2025-05-28.content: Column metadata indexing is now available for both [BigQuery tables](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/metadata-indexing-managed-tables) and [external tables](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/metadata-caching-external-tables). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Column Metadata Indexing Now GA
summary.summary: Column metadata indexing, a new feature for BigQuery, is now generally available for both managed and external tables. This enhancement improves data management and accessibility.

2025-05-27.content: You can now [share Pub/Sub streaming data through BigQuery sharing](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-stream-sharing) with additional [client libraries](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/analytics-hub) support and provider usage metrics. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Pub/Sub data sharing with BigQuery now GA
summary.summary: BigQuery streaming data sharing for Pub/Sub is now generally available. This feature supports additional client libraries and provides provider usage metrics.

2025-05-27.content: BigQuery offers [optional job creation mode](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/running-queries#optional-job-creation) to speed up small queries that you use in your dashboards, data exploration, and other workflows. This mode automatically optimizes eligible queries and uses a cache to improve latency. This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: BigQuery Optional Job Creation Mode is Ready
summary.summary: BigQuery now provides an optional job creation mode that automatically optimizes eligible queries and uses a cache to improve latency, making it faster for workflows like dashboards and data exploration. This feature is now generally available.
